Description: Four small shroud fragments with loose yarns of open, balanced, plain weave, cotton textile. The fabric has a net-like appearance. It is undyed and light brown. The spinning direction of the warp and weft is 's' and the warp thread count is 3, while the weft thread count is 3-6. Spaces between the yarns are 1.5-5mm and are of medium thickness, with a yarn diameter of approximately 0.51+/- 0.0mm and a tightness of twist of approximately 47 degrees. Frag. 1: open weave fabric with woven structure largely intact. Frag. 2: open weave fabric with woven structure largely intact. Frag. 3: small fragment of open weave. Frag. 4: tangled mass of threads. The threads are loosely orientated either vertically or horizontally with almost no discernible weave structure.
Bibliographic references: Adams et al 1999 / Kulubnarti III: The Cemeteries (p.65)
Acquisition name: Donated by: Dr William Yewdale Adams
Donated by: W S Webb Museum of Anthropology (University of Kentucky)
Additional IDs: Excavation/small finds number: 93.1.173A (excavation object cat. no.)
